1.title: Mute Button
1.plot: On the series premiere, Mike tries to recover from cursing on a conference call after forgetting he's on speaker.

2.title: What Do You Do?
2.plot: A visitor has trouble getting Mike to say what exactly his job is.

3.title: The Doorman
3.plot: When the neighboring building's doorman has trouble with his job responsibilities, it's up to Mike to coach him up on how to be a doorman.

4.title: Home Invasion
4.plot: Mike must figure out a way to keep his nosy landlord Vera from disrupting his work day.

5.title: Password Reset
5.plot: When Mike needs a new password, the company's IT guy Gerald is way too eager to help.

6.title: Office Dating
6.plot: Mike gives his boss Kevin some unsolicited romantic advice about dating a coworker.

7.title: Lunch Break
7.plot: Mike enlists Vera, the Doorman, an unsuspecting delivery guy and an old TV host to help spice up his lunch time experience.

imdb.plot outline: Mike Works from Home is a comedy web series about your every day typical office drone with one major difference: he's convinced his pushover of a boss to let him work from home five days a week. He then goes out of his way to get himself into a series of increasingly absurd scenarios to keep up the appearance of being busy and also fend off boredom - all without having to do any *real* work. Despite his unique situation, Mike faces the same challenges as anyone else working a 9-5: calling IT to reset his password, shouting obscenities while forgetting he's on speakerphone, stopping his maniacal Russian landlord from invading his apartment, staging a fake cooking competition reality show for lunch, and of course, conducting an in-home performance review without wearing pants.
imdb.title: Mike Works from Home
plot: _Mike Works from Home_ (qv) is a comedy web series about your every day typical office drone with one major difference: he's convinced his pushover of a boss to let him work from home five days a week. He then goes out of his way to get himself into a series of increasingly absurd scenarios to keep up the appearance of being busy and also fend off boredom - all without having to do any *real* work. Despite his unique situation, Mike faces the same challenges as anyone else working a 9-5: calling IT to reset his password, shouting obscenities while forgetting he's on speakerphone, stopping his maniacal Russian landlord from invading his apartment, staging a fake cooking competition reality show for lunch, and of course, conducting an in-home performance review without wearing pants.
